question_sentence: Which one of these popular musicians got married over the weekend?
White Sox manager Tony La Russa created a stir by criticizing a player on his team, Yermin Mercedes, for doing what?
choices: Hitting a homerun on a 3-0 pitch count in a lopsided game
Mistakenly throwing a ball into the stands in a lopsided game

question_sentence: The House voted to authorize a commission to investigate:
choices: The most recent violence in Gaza

question_sentence: Which lawmaker did House Republicans elect as Liz Cheney’s replacement to be the party’s House conference chair?
Texas Gov. Greg Abbott signed a bill banning abortion:
choices: Once a fetal heartbeat is detected

question_sentence: After two more no-hitters, Major League Baseball is set to shatter its record for a season. Which pitchers accomplished the feat this week?
This week, the largest recorded iceberg broke off from:
A new brood of periodical cicadas, which have emerged after 17 years underground, can emit sounds equivalent to a:
Which event will return in July as the first major multi-genre music festival in the U.S. since the pandemic began?
A former federal official acknowledged the existence of what during an interview with “60 Minutes?”
Network Rail is being jettisoned as part of sweeping reforms of mainland Britain’s train services that will see control handed to a new state-owned body called what?
Barack Obama privately described Donald Trump as what, according to a new book?
Israel and Hamas this week agreed a Gaza ceasefire deal after how many days of violence?
Spain deployed troops this week to stem the flow of around 8,000 migrants from Morocco into which small Spanish territory in north Africa?
Police searching for the body of a suspected victim of Fred West have excavated the cellar of what type of commercial property near the serial killer’s former Gloucestershire home?
The US Supreme Court has agreed to review an anti-abortion law from which state, in the biggest challenge to Roe v. Wade in a generation?
Thousands of people have flocked to an abandoned fuel station in San Francisco Bay to sniff a foul-smelling rare flower named what?
The Home Office has delayed the release of a report into the axe killing of private investigator Daniel Morgan in a London pub car park in what year?
Police in India are warning that black market scammers are cashing in on the Covid crisis by passing off which items as much-needed oxygen canisters?
A newly published report on social mobility in the UK civil service says senior officials often tell jokes in which ‘dead language’ during meetings?
House Republicans voted this week in favor of forming a commission to investigate what event?
evidence: If created, bipartisan commission would investigate January 6 attack on the US Capitol.

question_sentence: According to a market research firm, sales of this staple item are skyrocketing now that people are socializing more.
evidence: Though the makeup industry was hit hard by the pandemic, lipstick sales have recently jumped more than 80%, experts say.

question_sentence: The Supreme Court is taking up a key abortion case involving this state, which has tried to pass a law banning most abortions after 15 weeks.
evidence: The Supreme Court will be reviewing a 2018 law in Mississippi that bans most abortion after 15 weeks, similar to other state laws. With a 6-3 conservative majority in the Court, many view this as a potentially major challenge to Roe v. Wade.

question_sentence: The US is investigating a mysterious illness that affected two White House officials last year. The inexplicable combination of sensory experiences and physical symptoms have been reported in several instances around the world. What’s the colloquial name of this syndrome?
evidence: With cases first appearing in Cuba, the mysterious illness is referred to as “Havana Syndrome” and has affected over 100 US diplomats, spies and troops in other countries.

question_sentence: At least 6,000 migrants swam from Morocco to Ceuta, a bordering enclave belonging to which European country?
evidence: Ceuta is a Spanish enclave bordering Morocco. The event was the largest influx of illegal migration to the territory in a single day, Spanish authorities said.

question_sentence: According to Dr. Anthony Fauci, when will fully vaccinated people likely need a booster shot to keep up immunity to Covid-19?
evidence: Dr. Fauci, director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, said that vaccinated individuals will “require a booster sometime within a year or so after getting the primary.”

question_sentence: The US Senate unanimously passed a resolution calling for the withdrawal of Eritrean forces from which war-torn country?
evidence: The resolution calls for Eritrean forces to immediately withdraw from the war-torn northern Tigray region in Ethiopia. This follows a CNN investigation revealing that the soldiers were cutting off critical aid routes.

question_sentence: As the United States begins lifting Covid-19 restrictions, which major Chicago-based music festival is set to open at full capacity at the end of July?
evidence: Organizers announced that Lollapalooza will return to Grant Park this year from July 29 to August 1.

question_sentence: “This sucker’s quick.” What was President Joe Biden talking about when he made this remark this week?
evidence: The electric truck, called the F-150 Lightning, is the first electric iteration of Ford’s F-150 series, set to hit the market in 2022.

question_sentence: Corey Kluber of the New York Yankees pitched a no-hitter in a game against the Texas Rangers. When was the last time a Yankees pitcher achieved this feat?
evidence: The Yankees celebrated their last no-hitter in 1999.Kluber’s no-hitter was the MLB’s 6th of the season and second within a 24-hour period.
